Package examples.behavior.terminals

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CheckMemoryTerminal
    This class represents a terminal that returns success if the internal one bit memory of the agent is set to true, and failure otherwise.
    EmptyInFrontCheckTerminal
    This class represents a terminal that returns success if the field in front of the agent is empty, and failure otherwise.
    EnvironmentDependendTerminal<T>  
    FoodInFrontCheckTerminal
    This class represents a terminal that returns success if the field in front of the agent contains food, and failure otherwise.
    MarkerInFrontCheckTerminal
    This class represents a terminal that returns success if the field in front of the agent was marked by the agent, and failure otherwise.
    MarkFieldTerminal
    This class represents a terminal that always returns success and places or removes a mark on its current position on the world map.
    PheroInFrontCheckTerminal
    This class represents a terminal that returns success if the field in front of the agent contains pheromone, and failure otherwise.
    SetMemoryTerminal
    This class represents a terminal that always returns success and either sets the one bit memory of the agent to true or false.
    StepTerminal
    This class represents a terminal that lets the agent advance for one field in its current direction.
    TurnLeftTerminal
    This class represents a terminal that lets the agent changes its orientation by turning left.
    TurnRightTerminal
    This class represents a terminal that lets the agent changes its orientation by turning right.
    WallInFrontCheckTerminal
    This class represents a terminal that returns success if the field in front of the agent is a wall, and failure otherwise.
